entry.title: Winfield Blake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after a career as an opera singer and Broadway musical star, Winfield Blake (pictured) became a comedian in vaudeville as one half of the comic duo Blake and Amber?

entry.title: University Village (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Picasso sculpture at University Village was called "half as high and twice as sexy as the Great Sphinx of Egypt"?

entry.title: a bankrupt TV station in California (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that country music singer Buck Owens bought a bankrupt TV station in California from his sister?

entry.title: Nyah Mway (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 13-year-old Nyah Mway is thought to be the first Karen person killed by police in the United States?

entry.title: Haravijaya (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ratnākara's Haravijaya is the longest extant Sanskrit mahākāvya?

entry.title: Betty Brussel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 99-year-old swimmer Betty Brussel broke three competitive swimming records on the same day?

entry.title: diet culture (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that both scholars and activists believe that diet culture is often intertwined with racism and other forms of prejudice?

entry.title: G. R. Pantouw (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that G. R. Pantouw supported the Dutch puppet state of East Indonesia because he wanted to push the Netherlands into abandoning colonialism?

entry.title: a 1st-century statue of Aphrodite (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Cretan man found a 1st-century statue of Aphrodite while trying to drill a well, and then reburied it?
